sense.name: prepare for/put to action or use
sense.examples: It reads like a medical detective novel whose plot is the crusade that mobilized the nation. A rural school mobilized the people and miracles happened. He mobilized the English language and sent it into battle to steady his fellow countrymen.

sense.name: cause to move around
sense.examples: Dividing the ascending aorta mobilized the left main bronchus. Surgery typically takes 1-4 hours and in an uncomplicated case the patient is mobilized the next day. The slurry density was still increasing, but only about 20 percent of the sludge had been mobilized.
